title: Anisotropic Cage Evolution in Quasi-two-dimensional Colloidal Fluids
authors: Noman Hanif Barbhuiya and Chandan K. Mishra
abstract:
We experimentally explore the morphological evolution of cages in
quasi-two-dimensional suspensions of colloidal fluids, uncovering a complex
dynamic restructuring in the fluid. Although cages display isotropic evolution
in the laboratory frame, we observe a striking anisotropy when analyzed in the
displacement frame of the caged particles. Moreover, our findings reveal that
particles in specific but distinct regions of the cage predominantly contribute
to either its persistence or relaxation. Thus, our study provides a
coarse-grained microscopic picture of the structural relaxation of these fluids
through cage evolution, which has broader implications for the flow and phase
behavior of complex fluids in confined geometry.
